doc.after: Ancestral rhinoceroses are held to have first diverged from other perissodactyls in the Early Eocene Mitochondrial DNA comparison suggests the ancestors of modern rhinos split from the ancestors of Equidae around 50 million years ago 19 The extant family the Rhinocerotidae first appeared in the Late Eocene in Eurasia and the ancestors of the extant rhino species dispersed from Asia beginning in the Miocene 20
